text: In a female patient with 3-hydroxyisobutyryl-CoA hydrolase deficiency (HIBCHD; 250620), Peters et al. (2015)identified compound heterozygous mutations in the HIBCH gene: a single-basepair insertion (c.129dupA), and a c.1033G-A transition (610690.0007). The c.129dupA frameshift mutation introduces a stop codon 8 amino acids downstream. The missense c.1033G-A mutation predicts a gly345 to ser (G345S) change affecting the substrate binding pocket and was predicted to be damaging, with a Polyphen2 score of 0.997.
